attributes.description: Bag is dumped with contents.  This is the most common way of disposal.  Bag takes 6 to 9 months to deteriorate enough to allow materials inside the bag to start decomposition
attributes.title: Laubscher Meadows Landfill

attributes.description: Bag is dumped off at recycling center as either type 2 or 4 plastic depending label.  It is then separated, sorted, and broken down
attributes.title: Consolidated Recycling Co Inc

attributes.description:
Product arrived in Evansville and is distributed to local vendors including grocery stores

Product was purchased at the west side Wal-Mart

Product is purchased by individuals for single use
-most common life span is said to be about a week of use and up to a week of travel after use

Product is then dumped into land fill with contents

unique- you are allowed in some areas to dump the contents and bag and place the bag in types two and four recycling bins
attributes.title: Evansville, Indiana

attributes.description:
Trash bag is made under production mostly through blowing techniques.  Bag is composed of polyethylene, resins, polymers, and monomers.  Is made up of up to 30% recycled material

Material made at a Glad manufacturing HQ
attributes.title: Amherst, Virginia

attributes.description: Product is shipped from company to vendors throughout the US
attributes.title: Amherst, Virginia  to Evansville, Indiana
Evansville, Indiana to Consolidated Recycling Co Inc
attributes.description: Bad is transported to a recycling center
Reusable materials are repurchased by mother company and remade into new useable products
attributes.title: Consolidated Recycling Co Inc to Amherst, Virginia
Evansville, Indiana to Laubscher Meadows Landfill
